rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Gate
rooms.Description:
You are standing inside the Eastern Gate of the Garrison. You are impressed
by the design of the fortress and feel sorry for anyone who would ever
have to attack it. The walls are almost four feet thick and the huge steel
gate coupled with the wrought iron drawbridge make it seemingly impossible
to bust into this place. You see a tall tower to your west and a small
road running north-south along the eastern wall.

rooms.Name: Base of the Tower
rooms.Description:
There is a large mound of hard-packed dirt here which forms the base of
what appears to be a look-out tower. The tower is quite high and would
probabally give an unobstructed view for miles. North of here is a
small building with a large red cross painted on it, while to the south
is another building which looks like it houses soldiers. To the west you
spot a well and to your east lies the main gate for the Garrison.

rooms.Name: On the Tower
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a small platform half way up the look-out tower. You
can see the layout of the Garrison below you. You can climb back down from
here or continue upwards into the top of the tower.

rooms.Name: In the Watch-Tower
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the top of the look-out tower for the Garrison. The 
view is incredible from up here, you can see for miles and miles without
any obstruction blocking your view. You notice that the area surrounding
the Garrison has been cleared for a distance of at least 200 yards all
around so that anyone approaching the fortress can be detected with
ease.

rooms.Name: The Well
rooms.Description:
You are standing beside a deep well which is used as the main water supply
for the Garrison. Smells of what could be food drift to you from the south. 
To the north you spot a long, low building, which looks like it acts as
sleeping quarters for the soldiers. To the west you see a path that runs
along the western wall.

rooms.Name: West Wall
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a small road which runs east through the center of
the Garrison, and north-south along the western wall. To the east lies
the Garrison's water supply and the sounds of hand-to-hand combat drift
to you from the north.

rooms.Name: Mess Hall
rooms.Description:
The smell of food hits you as you enter the mess hall. This is where the
soldiers of the Garrison get together to eat while they are stationed
here. There are 3 long tables positioned side by side near the east wall and
a smaller table that looks like it is for officers only near the west wall.
At the south end of the mess hall you see a long table covered with the
remains of the last meal served in here.

rooms.Name: Food Stores
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in a cool cellar which looks like it was constructed
to store various food supplies for the Garrison. You see that shelves have
been built into three out of the four walls. The fourth wall is stacked
high with barrels. The shelves look much more bare than you would expect
for a Garrison of this size and you suppose that a shipment of goods must
be due soon. Large pots and other cooking instruments hang from various
hooks in the ceiling.

rooms.Name: Officers Quarters
rooms.Description:
You have found your way into the officers quarters. The room is less 
extravagant than you would have imagined it to be. It appears to be more
for functional purposes then to provide a haven of luxury for the officers.
There are single beds along the east and west walls of a size not to much
greater then one would find in regular barracks. A door leads to the south.

rooms.Name: Officers Lounge
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the officers lounge. It is a comfortable looking room
where the officers can get together to relax and trade stories. There
are some very comfortable looking chairs surrounding a round table.
The lounge is not overly extravagent but appears to be a suitable reward
for the men who have reached a high enough rank to be able to make use of
it. To the north is the officers barracks.

rooms.Name: Strategic Planning
rooms.Description:
You are in a dimly lit room which appears to be used for strategic planning
purposes by the officers of the Garrison. The walls are dotted with maps and
the main table is covered with a map and various measurement tools.

rooms.Name: The Barracks
rooms.Description:
You are inside the Garrison barracks. The building appears as though it 
was not designed for much more than sleeping in. The ceiling is quite
low and the building is very long. There are bunk beds arranged in rows
across the entire room. The sound of horses drifts in to this building
from the North.

rooms.Name: Medical Station
rooms.Description:
You are inside the Garrison's medical building. Various potions and salves
line the shelving on the walls. A number of various medical instruments,
at least that's what they appear to be, are lined neatly on a counter along
the west wall. From the north you can hear the moaning of someone in pain.

rooms.Name: Horse pen
rooms.Description:
The smell of horses and hay is overpowering as you enter the horse pens.
The pens appear to be well maintained and surprisingly clean. There are
two large stalls along each of the east and west walls that look as though
they could hold up to a dozen horses each. Hay is stacked in lofts above
each stall.

rooms.Name: Recovery Area
rooms.Description:
You are in the room in which the more seriously injured are placed so that
better care may be taken of them. There are four beds in this room for 
the recovery of injured soldiers. An atmosphere of discomfort and pain
hangs about this room. You can feel death in the air here.

rooms.Name: North-West Corner
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the north-west corner of the compound. A road which
runs beside the Garrison wall extends to the east and south. A small turret
has been built into the corner of the encampment to provide a position
from which the fortress can be defended and to supplement the main watch
tower for look-out purposes.

rooms.Name: North Wall
rooms.Description:
You are on a small road which runs east-west along the northern wall. The
smell and sounds of horses drift to you from the south. You notice that
this area and the area to the east have been widened and covered with dirt
to provide a small area for horse training. There are barrels scattered
about for riding practice as well as some training dummies for practicing
attacks while on horseback.

rooms.Name: North Wall
rooms.Description:
You are on a small road which runs east-west along the northern wall.
You notice that this area and the area to the west have been covered with 
dirt on either side of the road to provide an area for training soldiers
in the skills of horse back riding and attacking while on horses.
To your south is the rear of the medical buildings.

rooms.Name: North-East Corner
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the north-east corner of the compound. A road which
runs beside the Garrison wall extends to the west and south. A small turret
has been built into the corner of the encampment to provide a position
from which the fortress can be defended and to supplement the main watch
tower for look-out purposes.

rooms.Name: West Wall
rooms.Description:
You are on a small road which runs north-south along the western wall.
There is a small area beside the road which is used for the training of
soldiers in hand-to-hand combat. To your east is the side of the Garrison
barracks and you can hear the sound of horses from the north-east.

rooms.Name: East Wall
rooms.Description:
You are on a small road, almost a path, which runs north-south along
the eastern wall. A large clearing has been made on both sides of the
road to provide an area for sword training. Training swords are stacked
in an inset in the side of the eastern wall and training dummies are
set up on either side of the road.

rooms.Name: West Wall
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a small road which runs north-south along the western
wall of the Garrison. To the north-east is the side of the mess hall and
you can see the main watch tower looming above the mess hall just beyond it.

rooms.Name: East Wall
rooms.Description:
You are on a small road, almost a path, that runs north-south along
the eastern wall. This area couples as an archery practice area as you
notice that various archery targets have been set up along the wall.
To your west you notice the sides of two well constructed buildings.

rooms.Name: South-West Corner
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the south-west corner of the compound. A road which
runs beside the Garrison wall extends to the north and east. A small turret
has been built into the corner of the encampment to provide a position 
from which the fortress can be defended and to supplement the main watch
tower for look-out purposes.

rooms.Name: South Wall
rooms.Description:
You are on a small road which runs east-west along the southern wall of
the Garrison. There are some benchs and the remains of a small campfire
on the north side of the road. This looks like some sort of meeting place
for off-duty soldiers.

rooms.Name: South Wall
rooms.Description:
You are on a small road which runs east-west along the southern wall.
The rear of the officers lounge is to your north and beyond that you
can see the main watch tower rising above the ground in the center of
the Garrison.

rooms.Name: South-East Corner
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the south-east corner of the compound. A road which
runs beside the Garrison wall extends to the north and west. A small turret
has been built into the corner of the encampment to provide a position 
from which the fortress can be defended and to supplement the main watch
tower for look-out purposes.

rooms.Name: In the Turret
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a turret built into the corner of the Garrison. From
this vantage point you have an unobstructed view looking away from the
encampment for at least a few miles. Below you on the other side of the 
wall, you can look down into the deep moat which is lined with sharpened
spikes. Along the wall in either direction you notice that sharp rocks
and small bits of metal have been embedded into the top of the wall. You
also notice that short, sharp spikes are attached to the top of the wall
at an angle facing away from the Garrison.

rooms.Name: In the Turret
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a turret built into the corner of the Garrison. From
this vantage point you have an unobstructed view looking away from the
encampment for at least a few miles. Below you on the other side of the 
wall, you can look down into the deep moat which is lined with sharpened
spikes. Along the wall in either direction you notice that sharp rocks
and small bits of metal have been embedded into the top of the wall. You
also notice that short, sharp spikes are attached to the top of the wall
at an angle facing away from the Garrison.

rooms.Name: In the Turret
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a turret built into the corner of the Garrison. From
this vantage point you have an unobstructed view looking away from the
encampment for at least a few miles. Below you on the other side of the 
wall, you can look down into the deep moat which is lined with sharpened
spikes. Along the wall in either direction you notice that sharp rocks
and small bits of metal have been embedded into the top of the wall. You
also notice that short, sharp spikes are attached to the top of the wall
at an angle facing away from the Garrison.

rooms.Name: In the Turret
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a turret built into the corner of the Garrison. From
this vantage point you have an unobstructed view looking away from the
encampment for at least a few miles. Below you on the other side of the 
wall, you can look down into the deep moat which is lined with sharpened
spikes. Along the wall in either direction you notice that sharp rocks
and small bits of metal have been embedded into the top of the wall. You
also notice that short, sharp spikes are attached to the top of the wall
at an angle facing away from the Garrison.

rooms.Name: The Temple of Astalon
rooms.Description:
When you enter this temple, you notice the very solemn feeling of
spirit here. Astalon is the God of justice, and rightfully so.
He is protector of innocence, and vengeance for the meek. This
temple is almost barren, excepting the candlabras that provide
the glimmering light.

rooms.Name: The Altar Room
rooms.Description:
This room is decorated much like the entrance of the temple, excepting
the altar and large statue of the beautiful Killian, which seems to be
made of water! The altar stands against the far wall, and in which you
see offerings of gold and spice.

rooms.Name: The Inner Sanctum
rooms.Description:
This is the room where the most devout of the followers of Killian
offer themselves in exchange for her blessings. This room is a sacred
place to her followers. Glowing with bright light, resting upon
another altar rest the first raindrop that fell upon Midkemia, and
the first sapling of a great Nareth, the first tree. These are obviously
well protected by her followers.

Exits.Description: A black curtain hangs upon the wall.

rooms.Name: Before the Altar of Astalon
rooms.Description:
As you step up to the altar, you begin searching thru your life 
wondering if you have wronged anyone. You begin to doubt yourself
as you know you have, but will he take offense and reek havoc upon
your entering his temple? You see his statue; a strong god, with
a stern face and an accusing look. Perhaps you should make an offering,
for you are beginning to shake.

rooms.Name: The Inner Sanctum of Astalon
rooms.Description:
If you aren't pure of heart, you really shouldn't be here. This lavishly
furnished room is very bright and clean. Chairs made from rosewood and
silk rest against the wall, and are decorated with golden inlay. A circle
is marked in silver in the floor, and is about 5 yards in diameter.
Swords and rapiers made from exquisite materials hang upon the walls.

Exits.Description: A black curtain is hung upon the wall.

rooms.Name: Before the Altar of Fire
rooms.Description:
You step up the the altar as flames jump from below the floor in
front of you. This is more of a pit of hell than an altar, you think.
It looks as if stairs lead down into the altar. You see melted gold
coins on the steps, thrown in by soldiers or parents of soldiers, or
by smiths who ask for a good livelyhood. Huge spears of gold are
burning on both sides of the altar, but do not melt!

rooms.Name: Within the Altar of Fire
rooms.Description:
You gather all of your courage as you step into the flames. You step
through on the other side to find an arsenal! A five yard golden ring
inlaid upon the floor marks the site of divine instruction. Weapons
of all kinds line the walls, and some strange articles that you cannot
identify are scatter with the others. You feel a sense of strength
and an urge to exert force upon something pervade you. Although
flames burn everywhere in the room to provide bright light, it is
comfotable cool here.

Exits.Description: A black curtain is hung upon the wall .

rooms.Name: Before the Altar
rooms.Description:
You have pushed your way past the columns and silk, and now stand before
the altar of Banath. It is an upraised stone pillar, undecorated, with
only a few silver peices lying upon it. Thieves sure are stingy, unless
Banath endows them with a large booty, when they customarliy leave 
twenty percent to thier patron God. Circular obsidian stairs lead down
into darkness to your left.

rooms.Name: The Sanctum of Banath
rooms.Description:
You have entered the Sanctum of the Thieves, and thier God Banath.
This is where divine knowledge comes to those faithful to Him.
A golden cirlce is inlaid upon the floor and marked in quarters
with jewels. The room is dark and lit only woth four candles, one
burning in each corner.

Exits.Description: A black curtain hangs upon the wall.

rooms.Name: In the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
This huge hall is built over the temple of Lims-Kragma, and is just
as lavish as the entrance. Tapestries depicting a representation of
the chaos wars are hung upon the walls, and gold and silver columns
hold the marble ceiling above your head. Light eminates from the
walls and floor, flooding the temple.

rooms.Name: Before the Altar of Ishap
rooms.Description:
A huge ivory altar stands at the end of the hall, covered in gold and
jewels as offerings to the Highest One. It seems no one is brave enough
to touch the riches piled high upon it, for Ishap may not appreciate
theft from his followers.

rooms.Name: A Winding Ivory Staircase
rooms.Description:
This exquisite stair leads you further down into the earth. The bright
light still permeates your surroundings. As you go deeper, a calm 
sweeps over you, and you feel as if you are under some kind of spell.

rooms.Name: The Inner Sanctum of Ishap
rooms.Description:
Books upon books upon books line the walls. Scrolls by the hundreds are
neatly placed in holding shelves and are labeled by volume. Candles burn
to provide light for those who dwell in the knowledge of Ishap. This 
place is extremly calm and serene. Knowledge flows from this room
like a waterfall.

Exits.Description: A black curtain is hung upon the wall here.

rooms.Name: The Hall Behind the Statue of the Goddess of Death
rooms.Description:
This hall has no decorations of any kind. It is carved from the underground
stone that the city rests on. Small orbs of light hover scant inches from
the ceiling at five foor intervals to provide a dim light.

rooms.Name: The Hall Behind the Statue of the Goddess of the Natural World
rooms.Description:
This hall has no decorations of any kind. It is carved from the underground
stone that the city rests on. Small orbs of light hover scant inches from
the ceiling at five foor intervals to provide a dim light.

rooms.Name: The Hall Behind the Statue of the God of Justice
rooms.Description:
This hall has no decorations of any kind. It is carved from the underground
stone that the city rests on. Small orbs of light hover scant inches from
the ceiling at five foor intervals to provide a dim light.

rooms.Name: The Hall Behind the Staute of the God of War
rooms.Description:
This hall has no decorations of any kind. It is carved from the underground
stone that the city rests on. Small orbs of light hover scant inches from
the ceiling at five foor intervals to provide a dim light.

rooms.Name: The Hall Behind the Statue of the God of Thieves
rooms.Description:
This hall has no decorations of any kind. It is carved from the underground
stone that the city rests on. Small orbs of light hover scant inches from
the ceiling at five foor intervals to provide a dim light.

rooms.Name: The Hall Behind the Statue of the God of Life and Healing
rooms.Description:
This hall has no decorations of any kind. It is carved from the underground
stone that the city rests on. Small orbs of light hover scant inches from
the ceiling at five foor intervals to provide a dim light.

rooms.Name: A Hall Leading North
rooms.Description:
This hall has no decorations of any kind. It is carved from the underground
stone that the city rests on. Small orbs of light hover scant inches from
the ceiling at five foor intervals to provide a dim light.

rooms.Name: A Stair Circling the Domed Hall
rooms.Description:
You walk upon the stairs that lead into the halls of Ishap. The stairs
are carved from the stone of the hall, and you can see everything from
here, and it is quite a sight.

rooms.Name: The Priest's Domicile
rooms.Description:
This is a sparselt furnished room. Upon the floor lie soft rugs.
This is where the priests of the Goddess Lims-Kragma, the Goddess
of death, reside. All of her faithful and devoted servants wear black
robes which cover thier faces, which are a pale white. The High
Priestess presides over this place, for she is the nearest to her God.

rooms.Name: The Priest's Domicile
rooms.Description:
This is the residence of the faithful to Killian, Goddess of the forest
and fields and sea. A fountain burbles next to the wall, where plants
grow in the bright light of the magic. you notice that the floor here
is soil, instead of rock, and that a breeze calmly floats by you.

Exits.Description: A black curtain hangs upon the wall.
A black curtain is hung upon the wall.

rooms.Name: The Priest's Domicile
rooms.Description:
Here is the living quarters of the priests of Astalon, God of justice.
You see two torches burning on either side of an altar, which has
a set of golden scales wieghted evenly upon it. Pillows and rugs
line the marble floor.

Exits.Description: A black curtain is hung upon the wall.

rooms.Name: The Priest's Domicile
rooms.Description:
This domicile seems very warm. The floors are made from granite, and
a huge fire bellows in an extraordinarily lagre fireplace. Upon the walls
hang numerous weapons. Torches burn on the walls all around the room.
You can hear the clanks of metal against metal from another room.

Exits.Description: A black curtain is hung upon the wall.

rooms.Name: The Priest's Domicile
rooms.Description:
As you enter the dimly lit room, your eyes begin to focus. You notice
a large ebony table with tem chairs surrounding it. Upon the table 
rests food and drink. Daggers seem to be the eating utensils here.
You see a large chest, locked with a huge iron lock.

Exits.Description: A black curtain hangs upon the wall.

rooms.Name: The Priest's Domicile
rooms.Description:
This domicile is covered wall to wall in books and scrolls. These
priests seem enamored by knowledge, for they are all studying the
collection of works. Desks are placed face to face in the center of the
room, and share a common large candelabra.

rooms.Name: The Priest's Domicile
rooms.Description:
This domicile is sparsely furnished. The floor is made of marble and
has candle holders on the wall made from gold. A large tapestry
hangs on the far wall, with symbols that you cannot decipher.

Exits.Description: You see a black curtain hung on the wall.

rooms.Name: A Small Chapel
rooms.Description:
This is where the priests of Ishap make thier vows and devotions
to thier God. This is a place of personal growth and premonitions.
Priests gain insight and knowledge here and sometimes even have 
visions.

rooms.Name: The Priests' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.Description:
This rooms is very unprivate. Mats lie on the floor where the priests
sleep at night, or rest during the day. You see about forty mats
here; there must be many od Ishap's servants here.

rooms.Name: The Priests' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.Description:
This room has no lighting whatsoever. Using your light source, you see
single beds, with black drapes hanging over them, lined against the
walls. There seems to be thirty beds here. Your light glimmers
off of the marble floor with golden inlay and you wonder how anyone
could live in such darkness.

rooms.Name: A Small Chapel
rooms.Description:
This chapel's walla are coated entirely of obsidian. The light from
the two candles sitting on the small altar glimmer off the walls like
you are surrounded by diamonds. A small stone sits in frony of the altar
for the priests to kneel upon when offering thier devotions.

rooms.Name: A Small Chapel
rooms.Description:
This chapel is dedicated to Killian, by the priests who are devoted to
her. This chapel is like a large atrium, with a fountain burbling
from the wall into a pool that takes up half of the floor space in the
room. PLants grow all around the pool, and small birds hop from
branch to branch of the larger plants. You can see how the preists
con be so serene here.

rooms.Name: The Priests' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.Description:
This room has plants growing all over it. You see where the priests
have been sleeping upon the soil. The room is cool, and a breeze flows
through the room and the light isnt too bright, when you look up, it
seems that you can see the night sky, although you know that you are
underground.

rooms.Name: A Small Chapel
rooms.Description:
This chapel is made entirely of marble. That includes the small
altar and offering stone on the far wall. Other than that, this
rooms is barren,

rooms.Name: The Priests' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.Description:
This room is as barren as the rest, with simple beds lining the walls.
Like the others, it is made compltely of marble. Obviously, justice
is blind to wealth and poverty

rooms.Name: A Small Chapel
rooms.Description:
Fire dominates this room as well. How anyone could concentrate or 
meditate in this room, you have no idea. Upon the small altar lie
broken weapons, as well as fine articles such as the silver dagger
you see there.

rooms.Name: The Priests' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.Description:
This room is lit by torches all around the walls. Beds lie against the walls
under each torch. Weapons of all kinds are ornamentally hung upon the wall,
and tapestries are hung next to each bed, each showing a different
group.

rooms.Name: A Small Chapel
rooms.Description:
This room doesn't look much like a chapel. The walls are covered in black 
silk and a dagger has been plunged into the stone altar. Two candles
burn on the altar and you hear movement close by.

rooms.Name: The Priests' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.Description:
Between the drapes of silk hanging all over the room, you see small beds
covered in black. The priests must sleep easy in this room, if they once
were thieves. You wonder how long they are going to let you stay in
thier domicile...

rooms.Name: A Small Chapel
rooms.Description:
This small chapel's walls are made of a glowing white material. When you
enter, your wound seem to feel better and a peace pervades your spirit.
You begin to think that you would like to rest here for some time, for
you seem to feel really good just being here.

rooms.Name: The Priests' Sleeping Quarters
rooms.Description:
This room is quite dark compared to the rest of Sung's sanctum.
The walls are still white, and bed also line the walls of the long
narrow room. You begin to think that you need to take a nap.

rooms.Name: Barrett's Coffee House
rooms.Description:
This establishment is famous in Krondor for its wonderful and exotic
blends of coffee. This quaint building is small, and well lit, with
round tables scattered about. A waiter walks around with a tray of
dirty cups, and a white cloth draped over his arm.

Exits.Description: A small wooden door can barely be detected trhough the smoke.

rooms.Name: A Small Dwelling
rooms.Description:
This is the home of the owner of Barrett's. Surprisingly, his name isn't
Barrett. There are shelves full of litigation papers lined against the
walls, and a desk sits near a fireplace with a lantern burning atop.

Exits.Description: A small wooden door is barely noticeable through the smoke.

rooms.Name: The Entrance To The Arena
rooms.Description:
This is where the action is! The people of Krondor flock to this arena
to watch duels, battles, fights, and executions. Prisoners who are captured
and convicted of murders and warcrimes are brought from the palace
dungeon, which happenes to be connected to this building underneath by
passages, to duel for thier lives, or to be executed. To the west you
see a vast room, over one hundred yards across, with wooden benches
surrounding it on all sides.

rooms.Name: A Guard Station
rooms.Description:
This two story building stands to house guards to watch the palace
gates around the clock. Bowmen with huge longbows stnd atop a balcony
overlooking the street. Swordsmen stand at the gate outside, and in here
is a desk with a Krondorian guard flipping thru arrival and departure
schedules.

rooms.Name: The Barracks
rooms.Description:
This is where the gate guards are house for a three week rotation in and
out of the palace. It is small and cramped, but serves the palace
well.

rooms.Name: The Northern Road
rooms.Description:
You step through the gates to find that a portal has opened in front of
you. It shines with an eerie green glow that attracts you closer. It
swirls, twists and congeals the light that eminiates from the center.
You begin to wonder if you should enter, for your insides may get the
same treatment as the light.

Exits.Description: A huge wrought iron gate is here, well maintained.

rooms.Name: The Shrine at Sethanon
rooms.Description:
As you look around the room, you notice it reminds you of a large temple,
yet it is underground. The lights are dim and you see shimmering in a corner.
People dressed in white robes line two sides of the hall. An altar rests
upon a dias on which sets a huge glowing green gem with a golden hilted
sword forced into it. The gem pulsates and changes in varying patterns
and shades of green. You hear an audible sigh from some large creature.
